1.brief: properly, to touch, i.e. lay the hand upon (for any purpose; euphemistically, to lie with a woman); by implication, to reach (figuratively, to arrive, acquire); violently, to strike (punish, defeat, destroy, etc.)
the new moon; by implication, a month
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity
a city (a place guarded by waking or a watch) in the widest sense (even of a mere encampment or post)
to gather for any purpose; hence, to receive, take away, i.e. remove (destroy, leave behind, put up, restore, etc.)
a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
properly, united, i.e. one; or (as an ordinal) first
near, with or among; often in general, to
Jerushalaim or Jerushalem, the capital city of Palestine

Jeshua, the name of ten Israelites, also of a place in Palestine
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)

a brother (used in the widest sense of literal relationship and metaphorical affinity or resemblance (like father))
literally one officiating, a priest; also (by courtesy) an acting priest (although a layman)

to ascend, intransitively (be high) or actively (mount); used in a great variety of senses, primary and secondary, literal and figurative

3.brief: properly, to be erect (i.e. stand perpendicular); hence (causatively) to set up, in a great variety of applications, whether literal (establish, fix, prepare, apply), or figurative (appoint, render sure, proper or prosperous)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications

4.brief: to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application

a festival, or a victim therefor
to grave, by implication, to write (describe, inscribe, prescribe, subscribe)
a step or (collectively, stairs, as ascending); usually a holocaust (as going up in smoke)

a step or (collectively, stairs, as ascending); usually a holocaust (as going up in smoke)

the new moon; by implication, a month
